introduction: The Advanced Remote Sensing and GIS Lab is designed to provide an interactive and simulation-based approach to understanding GIS applications and remote sensing instruments. Through virtual labs, users can explore fundamental GIS software-based experiments such as georeferencing, cartography, and DEM data analysis, which are typically available only in licensed GIS software. The lab also focuses on high-precision remote sensing instruments, covering aspects such as instrument setup, calibration, data collection, preprocessing, and analysis. By leveraging simulation and software interfaces, these experiments bridge the gap between theoretical concepts and practical applications in the GIS and remote sensing domain.

experiments.name: LAI using leaf area index meter
Extraction of Topographical features using DEM data
Digitization of feature classes in GIS through Vector Layers
Photogrammetry: RGB data capturing using UAV
Georeferencing aerial maps using DGPS (Differential GPS)
Solar Panel monitoring using datas from UAV with thermal camera

objective: The intention of developing Advanced Remote Sensing and GIS Lab virtual lab is to provide a quick, easy understanding of GIS application and various remotely operated instruments. The virtual labs provide a platform to perform and understand GIS software based experiments like Georeferencing ,cartography and DEM data analysis which otherwise is a part of Licensed GIS software. Understanding the working of high precision remote sensing instruments, the experiments provide details over setting up the instrument, calibration, taking reading, preprocessing the obtained data using the softwares linked to the instrument, analyzing the results and its application in the GIS domain. The development of the lab is an attempt to understand the concepts of GIS and remote sensing instruments through simulation and software like interfaces.
